title: Liberty’s Last Line of Defense
sub_head: State attorneys general best serve when they eschew partisanship.
body:
New administrations of both parties have a tendency to try to accomplish their policy goals by executive decree. As the rush of a campaign meets the reality of governing, incoming presidents and staffers grow frustrated with the messy details of bicameralism and presentment—sign-off from both chambers and the president—required to enact new laws. Having served in the Senate, I can understand the frustration.
But who is there to protect and defend the rule of law from an overeager new administration? State attorneys general,...
